title.native: 魔入りました！入間くん 第3シリーズ
title.english: Welcome to Demon School! Iruma-kun Season 3

description:
The third season of Mairimashita! Iruma-kun.

This time it's the jungle!

Human boy Suzuki Iruma becomes "grandson" to the great demon Sullivan and begins attending demon school where "Grandpa" serves as chairman. Winning friends -- and rising in demon rank, too -- Iruma thrives in his new environment, overcoming the harrowing ordeals thrown his way! In the new season, further challenges await... it's harvest season, and time for the annual test where students wade into the expansive and extremely dangerous (!) jungle to compete for food!! Classmates become rivals, and what erupts is a gargantuan battle of brawn and wits?

(Source: NHK)
synonyms: อิรุมะคุง พจญในแดนปีศาจ! ภาค 3

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Succubus
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a succubus, a creature in medieval folklore that typically uses their sexual prowess to trap and seduce people to feed off them.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Wilderness
tags.description: Predominantly features a location with little to no human activity, such as a deserted island, a jungle, or a snowy mountain range.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/81658029) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akimitsuhomma/) | [Website](https://akimitsuhomma.com/)

He was part of the music group [Vink](https://anilist.co/staff/228057/).

FANTASTICS is part of the collective supergroup EXILE TRIBE and composed of 8 members: 2 vocalists and 6 performers. The group was formed in 2016 as a performance unit with two EXILE members and 5 EXPG students. In late 2017, two vocalists were added from the VOCAL BATTLE AUDITION 5.

They made their major debut on December 5, 2018, with the single "OVER DRIVE". (Source: EXILE TRIBE Wiki)

Members as of May 2023: [Sekai](https://anilist.co/staff/337395) · Taiki Sato · Natsuki Sawamoto · Leiya Seguchi · Natsuki Hori · Keito Kimura · Yusei Yagi · Sota Nakajima

Forner Member: Nakao Shota (passed away on July 6, 2018, at a hospital in Tokyo due to complications of stomach cancer)

[Website](http://wed-camp.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/wed_camp) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/WednesdayCampanella) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0bp9CvkjQYhUJvWRHjFRWI) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCt30iKDSksaJ0hbd363ETfA)

Wednesday Campanella is a Japanese music group formed in 2012 combining musical genres such as EDM, J-pop, and hip hop into a unique stylistic blend. From 2013 until 2021, the trio consisted of KOM_I, Kenmochi Hidefumi, and Dir.F. KOM_I departed in September 2021, with new vocalist Utaha joining the group.

Members
• [Kenmochi Hidefumi](https://anilist.co/staff/155114/Hidefumi-Kenmochi) (釼持英郁 or ケンモチヒデフミ) - music, lyrics - born August 2, 1981, in Shinagawa.
• Utaha (詩羽) - performer, singer - born August 9, 2001, in Tokyo.
• Dir.F. (Yasutomo Fukunaga, 福永泰朋) - director, utility man - born in 1982.

**Former members**
• [KOM_I](https://anilist.co/staff/156650/KOM-I) (コムアイ) - performer, singer - born July 22, 1992, in Kanagawa.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/833502238538506241)

Worked as a production assistant before starting as an animator in 2017.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/833502238538506241)

Worked as a production assistant before starting as an animator in 2017.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mello__vitor/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/VitorMelloVO) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/vitor.melomoraes)

Vitor Mello de Moraes is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director. He is the younger brother of former voice actor [Bruno Mello](https://anilist.co/staff/231430/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Charles "Charlie" Spring (Heartstopper)
- Colin Bridgerton (Bridgerton)
- Valerio Montesinos Rojas (Elite)
- Samuel Douglas "Sam" Gardner IV (Atypical)
- Carlos Victor Rodriguez (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Luka Colucci (Rebelde 2022)
- Peter Doppler (Dark)
- Billy Andrews (Anne with an E)
- Inojin Yamanaka (Naruto X Boruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections)
- Kitty (Battle Kitty)
- Diazo (Strange World)
- Benjamin "Ben" Florian (Descendants: The Royal Wedding)
- Jeong Jin-Hwan (A Love So Beautiful)
- Teylan (Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora)
- Fjor Jutul (Ragnarok)
- Mark Tedder (Blood & Water)
!~
